title: ICE with associated existential type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
Hi,

I'm guessing this error is known, but it appears to fail in a different way compared to #54899.

Code:

```rust
#![feature(existential_type)]


trait IterBits {
    type BitsIter: Iterator<Item = u8>;
    fn iter_bits(self, n: u8) -> Self::BitsIter;
}

existential type IterBitsIter<T, E, I>: std::iter::Iterator<Item = I>;

impl<T, E> IterBits for T where T: std::ops::Shr<Output = T> + std::ops::BitAnd<T, Output = T> + std::convert::From<u8> + std::convert::TryInto<u8, Error = E>,
                                E: std::fmt::Debug
{
    type BitsIter = IterBitsIter<T, E, u8>;
    fn iter_bits(self, n: u8) -> Self::BitsIter {
        (0u8..n)
            .rev()
            .map(move |shift| ((self >> T::from(shift)) & T::from(1)).try_into().unwrap())
    }
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=7620e6f3a5ec5622a68bb24a993c53fa))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: type parameter `E` is part of concrete type but not used in parameter list for existential type
  --> src/lib.rs:14:49
   |
14 |       fn iter_bits(self, n: u8) -> Self::BitsIter {
   |  _________________________________________________^
15 | |         (0u8..n)
16 | |             .rev()
17 | |             .map(move |shift| ((self >> T::from(shift)) & T::from(1)).try_into().unwrap())
18 | |     }
   | |_____^

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/libcore/option.rs:347:21
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
             at src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:39

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:308

             at src/libcore/panicking.rs:85

             at src/libcore/panicking.rs:49
```
